newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Stocks stable in light trading.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Stocks stable in light trading.

text.p: Trading was flat after the U.S. market close Wednesday, with several companies releasing earnings performances or expectations, but none prompting trades out of line with closing prices.
"I'm not really showing anything," a trader said when asked if any stocks were trading off their normal ranges after the bell.
York International Corp said it expected second quarter earnings per share to come in at $0.95 to $1.00 compared with a year-ago figure of $1.05, but did not trade.
"There's really not too much happening," another trader said.
Nor did dealership operator Cross-Continent Auto Retailers Inc see any stock action after announcing that its second quarter earnings results might fall short of expectations.

The after-hours calm followed a day dampened by warnings from two large technololgy companies, Seagate Technology Inc and Gateway 2000 Inc, that their quarterly results would be lower than Wall Street forecasts. Combined with an under-expectation quarterly performance reported by Oracle Corp, the news helped end a string of record Nasdaq closing highs.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one volume was 72,700 on Wednesday, up from 45,700 the previous day. Session two volume, meanwhile, fell to 180,000, compared with 2,175,046 on Tuesday.
